Abstract: EVALUATES PROJECT PERFORMANCE FROM 4/15/70 TO 10/15/70 IN AFGHANISTAN. CONTRACTOR AIDS ROYAL GOVT OF AFGHANISTAN (RGA) TO DEVEL ITS CADASTRAL PROGRAM THROUGH PERSONNEL TRAINING & ADVISORY SERVICES. EVALUATN METHODOLOGY BASED ON OBSERVATNS,REPORTS & DISCUSSNS WITH STAFF. EVALUATOR FEELS CONTRACTOR HAS COMPLIED WITH ALL CONTRACT REQUIREMTS & PERFORMED WELL BY MAINTAINING GOOD WORKING RELATNS WITH USAID/AFGHANISTAN & RGA. ALL CONTRACTOR REPORTS HAVE BEEN ON TIME & GOOD LEADERSHIP IS APPARENT. RGA'S CADASTRAL SYSTEM HAS IMPROVED DURING THIS EVALUATN PERIOD. SCHEDULED LAND SURVEYS WILL EASILY BE COMPLETED BY THE END OF THE 5-YR CONTRACT. SUGGESTNS OF A NEW PAS ADVISOR, FAMILAR WITH REAL PROPERTY TAXATN & RGA REVENUE ADMINISTRATN, HAS RESULTED IN SUBSTANTIAL RECOMMENDATNS FOR CHANGE IN THE PROJ WITH A PHASE-OUT OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE SURVEY PROGRAM. THE ADVISOR'S PLACEMT IN THE MINISTRY OF FINANCE (MOF) ENABLED HIM TO IMPROVE ADMINISTRATIVE CHANGE IN TAX PURPOSES WITH A NEW SUB-PROJ BEING RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ENTIRE RANGE OF REVENUE ADMINISTRATN IN THE MOF. ADVISOR'S RECOMMENTATNS ARE TO TRANSFER LAND SURVEYS TO THE USAID ENGINEERING DIV UPON TERMINATN OF THE LAND INVENTORY PROJ IN 9/71. THE FINAL 172 STUDENTS, TO BE GRADUATED 3/71, HAVE BEEN ENROLLED IN THE CADASTRAL SURVEY TRAINING PROGRAM. AFTER THIS 1971 GRADUATN MAN-POWER REQUIREMTS OF THE CADASTRAL SURVEY ORGANIZATN WILL BE SUFFICIENT FOR SEVERAL YEARS. NO NEW EMPLOYEES WILL BE RECRUITED UNTIL AFTER AT LEAST 2 YRS WORK EXPERIENCE OF THE 1971 CLASS. A SELECTED NUMBER OF AFGHAN SURVEYORS ARE PRESENTLY RECIEVING ADDITIONAL TRAINING IN THE US, PLANS ARE TO PROVIDE 6 ADDITIONAL SURVEYORS WITH MICROFILMING TRAINING IN IRAN & TRAIN 2 SURVEYORS LOCALLY CONCERNING INSTRUMT REPAIR & MAINTENANCE TECHNIQUES.
Descriptors_Topical: Real property taxes|Taxation|Real property|Tax assessments|Technical training|Cadasters|Management operations
Title: EVALUATION OF CONTRACTOR PERFORMANCE (U-367) -PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION SERVICE, AID/NESA-359

Abstract: EVALUATES PROJECT PERFORMANCE FROM 1968 TO 1971 IN US, PHILIPPINES, MEXICO, COLOMBIA, ETC. PROJ OBJECTIVE IS AN ECONOMICALLY FEASIBLE MEANS FOR SAFE & EFFECTIVE VERTEBRATE PEST CONTROL (VPC) WHICH WILL INCREASE FOOD SUPPLIES WHEN APPLIED ON A REGIONAL BASIS. ANNUAL REPORTS,PROJ UNIT ACCOMPLISHMNT SUMMARIES & SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATNS WERE EXAMINED. LG POPULATNS OF VP'S IN LDC'S REDUCE PRODUCTN,DAMAGE STORED FOODS,& CARRY DISEASE. BIOLOGICAL CONTROL IS BEING DEVELOPED BASED ON BIOLOGY,PHYCHOLGY,BEHAVIOR,LIFE CYCLE,& SMELL/TASTE PREFERENCES OF VP'S. VP'S IN MANY LDC'S HAVE BEEN STUDIED BUT MORE RESEARCH HAS BEEN PERFORMED VAMPIRE BATS (MEXICO),RATS (PHILIPPINES),& BIRDS (COLOMBIA). VPC TECH IN THESE PILOT NATNS WILL  BE PERFECTED & SHARED LDC'S FACING THE SAME OR SIMILAR PRO  BS. TEAM FEELS RESEARCHERS ARE CAPABLE,ENTHUSIASTIC,& HAVE CONSIDERABLE RESEARCH IMAGINATN. MEXICO'S VAMPIRE BAT PROBIS SIMILAR TO THAT OF MANY OTHER LATIN COUNTRIES. SINCE BATS  ARE NOT BIOLOGICALLY SICCESSFUL (BS),ONCE REDUCED IN NUMBER THEY WILL BE EASILY CONTROLED. VAMPIRES WHICH CARRY RABIES FEED ON CATTLE. CHEMICALS TOXIC TO BATS BUT NOT HOSTS HAVE BEEN APPLIED TO RECENT BITES SINCE BATS OFTEN RETURN TO OLD WOUNDS. METAL PLATES HAVE BEEN ATTACHED TO BATS SO FLIGHT & FEEDING PATTERNS MAY BE STUDIED ELECTRONICLY. RAT RESEARCH IN THE PHIL HAS THE CONFIDENCE OF THE GOV & ITS AGENCIES. RATS ARE DIFFICULT TO CONTROL SINCY THEY ARE BS,& ADAPTABLE. RESEARCH W/CHEMOSTERILANTS HAS PROVED SUCCESSFUL WITH SOME SPECIES. STUDIES INDICATE REDUCTNS IN DAMAGE TO PADDY RICE BY REDUCING VEGETATN COVER ON DIKES. BIRD & RODENT PROBS IN S AM HAVE BEEN LESS STUDIED. CHEMICAL REPELLENTS MAY BE ACCEPTABLE FOR CONTROLLING BIRDS SUCH AS THE EARED DOVE,DICKCISSILS,& PSITTIDS WHICH DESTROY SEED CROPS. ZINC PHOSPHIDE LOOKS PROMISING IN REDUCING COTTON RATS. EVALUATOR RECOMMENDS REFUNDING SINCE PROJ HAS PRODUCED SCIENTIFIC DISCOVERIES & PUBLICATNS,& BIBLIOGRAPHIES ON VARIOUS VP'S. INSTITUTN BUILDING WILL CONTINUE TO BE A MAJOR FACTOR IN DEV,PLANNING,& RESEARCH. EVALUATORS RECOMMEND OUTREACH OF NEW VPC TECH TO FARMERS &THAT LOCALS BE TRAINIED TO DO RESEARCH.
Descriptors_Topical: SUGAR CANE|PESTICIDES|Birds|PEST CONTROL|Vampire bats|Food losses|Rodents|ECOLOGY|Biology research|Technical assistance

Abstract: ALTHOUGH TITLE II AID IS LARGE, IT ONLY TEMPORARILY RELIEVES A SMALL FRACTION OF THE MALNUTRITION PROBLEM. CURRENT EFFORTS TOUCH NO MORE THAN A THIRD TO A FIFTH OF THE MOTHERS AND CHILDREN IN NEED OF DIETARY IMPROVEMENT. EVEN THESE FEEDING EFFORTS ARE NOT ALWAYS CONTINUOUS FOR THE INDIVIDUALS CONCERNED. ONLY LIMITED GAINS ARE BEING REALIZED IN TEACHING ABOUT FOODS AND NUTRITION. THE MALNUTRITION PROBLEM JUSTIFIES A PROGRAM LARGER THAN THE PRESENT ONE. HOWEVER, US DONATIONS HAVE BEEN CHECKED BY THE FAILURE OF THE GOVERNMENT AND PRIVATE GROUPS IN EL SALVADOR TO PROVIDE THE FINANCIAL AND HUMAN RESOURCES NEEDED TO DISTRIBUTE MORE COMMODITIES. THE PHYSICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE PIPELINE NOW FUNCTIONS WELL. PROCEDURES FOR THE CONTINUOUS MEASUREMENT OF PROGRESS IN OVERCOMING MALNUTRITION -- THE RELATING OF INPUTS TO OUTPUTS -- ARE LACKING AND ARE RECOMMENDED. TO DATE, US GOVERNMENT EFFORTS TO ASSIST ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN EL SALVADOR DO NOT SEEM TO HAVE STRESSED SUFFICIENTLY THE NEED FOR A STRONG COMMITMENT TO OVERCOMING MALNUTRITION. THE EVALUATORS RECOMMEND CHANGES IN PROGRAM EMPHASIS AND DESIGN, IMPROVED PROGRAM COORDINATION AND CONTROL, AND COMMODITY STORAGE.
Descriptors_Topical: Food for Peace|FOOD FOR WORK|NUTRITION|Maternal child health care|School feeding programs|Community development|Nutrition education|FOOD STORAGE
Title: PL-480 TITLE II ACTIVITIES IN EL SALVADOR; A PROGRAM EVALUATION

Abstract: THE EVALUATION, WHICH IS BASED ON ESMAN'S "INSTITUTION BUILDING FRAMEWORK," DISCUSSED THE UNIVERSIDAD NACIONAL AGRARIA (UNA), THE DIRECCION GENERAL DE INVESTIGACIONES AGRO-PECUARIAS (DGIA), THE DIRECCION GENERAL DE PROMOCION AGROPECUARIA (DGPA), AND PROJECTS RELATED TO THE NATIONAL FOOD COMMODITY PROGRAMS. OF THE THREE INSTITUTIONS, UNA HAS ADVANCED FURTHEST TOWARD THE INSTITUTIONAL GOALS IT SET FOR ITSELF. THIS IS BECAUSE IT IS AUTONOMOUS, ITS LEADERS AND STAFF HAVE HAD A CLEAR IDEA OF THE DEVELOPMENT GOALS THEY WISHED TO REACH, AND DURING THE FORMATIVE YEARS THEY WERE ABLE TO ASSEMBLE THE RESOURCES TO DO THE JOB. THE DGIA IS LESS ADVANCED IN INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT THAN THE UNA. THE BASIC PROBLEM IS THAT THE DGIA HAS TECHNICAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR A LARGE DECENTRALIZED NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH PROGRAM. THE DGPA IS THE LARGEST OF THE THREE INSTITUTIONS AND HAS DIVERSE RESPONSIBILITIES. ITS INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT HAS BEEN SOMEWHAT LESS THAN IN THE DGIA AND UNA. THE EVALUATORS MADE RECOMMENDATIONS THROUGHOUT THE TEXT INCLUDING: (1)THE PRESENT COLLABORATION IN NATIONAL FOOD COMMODITY PROGRAMS OF THE MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AS A MEDIUM FOR INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT SHOULD BE CARRIED FORWARD IN A WAY THAT FULLY RECOGNIZES THE STAGES OF DEVELOPMENT OF EACH PROJECT; AND (2)LINKAGES BETWEEN REGIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND THE DGIA, DGPA, AND UNA SHOULD BE FOSTERED.
Descriptors_Topical: Institution building|Agricultural research|Agricultural extension|Agricultural education|Potatoes|BEANS|RICE|Forage crops|Animal nutrition
Title: PRELIMINARY REPORT OF THE SELF-EVALUATION BY THE NORTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY AID MISSION TO PERU

Abstract: AT A MEETING OF GROUPS INVOLVED WITH THE PROJECT, THE 1971 PACKAGE FOR RICE WAS CONFIRMED BUT SUBSTANTIAL CHANGES IN THE MAIZE PACKAGE WERE RECOMMENDED. MOST COOPERATING RICE FARMERS HAVE SUCCEEDED IN DOUBLING OR TRIPLING YIELDS; THERE IS NO COMPARABLE DATA FOR MAIZE FARMERS. RECOMMENDED RICE PRACTICES SHOULD BE DISSEMINATED AS WIDELY AS POSSIBLE; HOWEVER, LARGE-SCALE DISSEMINATION OF THE MAIZE PACKAGE IS NOT RECOMMENDED. DISCUSSION OF THE PROJECT IMPACT, WHICH FOLLOWS, IS TENTATIVE, PENDING THE UNIVERSITY OF IFE SURVEY RESULTS. (1)EXTENSION EFFORT AND SUCCESS WERE STRONGER WITH RICE THAN WITH MAIZE. (2)THE AGRICULTURAL AND INDUSTRIAL INVESTMENT CORPORATION WANTS TO LAUNCH A RICE-MAIZE CREDIT PROGRAM. (3)MOST RICE FARMERS USED FERTILIZER WHERE IT WAS RECOMMENDED; FERTILIZER WAS NOT WIDELY AVAILABLE TO MAIZE COOPERATORS. THE SUPPLY FOR THE 1972 GROWING SEASON WILL BE ADEQUATE IF DISTRIBUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE SOLVED. (4)IMPROVED SEED WAS IN SHORT SUPPLY FOR THE 1971 GROWING SEASON. ADEQUATE IMPROVED SEED WILL BE AVAILABLE TO MEET ANTICIPATED 1972 DEMAND. (5) MECHANIZED SERVICES WERE NOT DELIVERED ON SCHEDULE. (6)THE PROJECT HAS DEALT ONLY INDIRECTLY WITH STORAGE AND MARKETING PROBLEMS. (7)THE PROJECT SUFFERED EXTENSIVELY FROM A LACK OF INTEGRATION INTO NORMAL PLANNING AND DECISION-MAKING SYSTEMS OF THE MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES.
Title: DRAFT INTERIM EVALUATION REPORT ON THE RICE-MAIZE PRODUCTION PROJECT

Abstract: THE EVALUATION DISCUSSES THE CENTRAL OFFICE OF THE OPPORTUNITIES INDUSTRIALIZATION CENTER (OIC) IN THE UNITED STATES, AND THE OIC PROGRAMS IN NIGERIA AND GHANA. THE PROGRAMS' ORGANIZATION AND STRUCTURE; RELATIONS WITH COMMUNITY, INDUSTRY, AND GOVERNMENT; QUALITY OF INSTRUCTION; PROJECTIONS; AND OTHER MATTERS ARE DISCUSSED. THE LAGOS OIC BOARD HAS MADE MUCH PROGRESS IN SECURING THE SUPPORT OF COMMUNITY, INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT. THE BOARD NEEDS ADDITIONAL HELP TO EXTEND ITS ACTIVITIES, PRIMARILY WITH INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT, IN ORDER TO ESTABLISH A BROADER BASE FOR CONTINUING SUPPORT FROM THESE SOURCES. GHANA GOVERNMENT ECONOMIC POLICIES HAVE CREATED A FIXED LABOR MARKET IN THE ACCRA-TEMA AREA WITH LITTLE JOB TURNOVER AND THUS, LIMITED HIRING. THESE POLICIES LIMIT THE NUMBER OF SKILLED TRAINEES WHO CAN BE PLACED IN ENTRY LEVEL JOBS IN THE ACCRA-TEMA AREA. THERE IS, HOWEVER, GOVERNMENT AND BUSINESS INTEREST AND SUPPORT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SMALL SERVICE AND MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY OUTSIDE THE MAJOR METROPOLITAN AREAS. TRAINING DIRECTED TOWARD SELF-EMPLOYMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT OUTSIDE THE ACCRA-TEMA AREA WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF JOBS AVAILABLE FOR OIC TRAINEES. THE EVALUATION HAS 16 RECOMMENDATIONS ABOUT THE OIC CENTRAL OFFICE AND THE PROGRAMS IN GHANA AND NIGERIA.
Title: ASSESSMENT OF THE OPPORTUNITIES INDUSTRIALIZATION CENTERS INTERNATIONAL PROGRAM

Abstract: THE EVALUATOR RATED THIS PROJECT IN THE TOP 10% OF SIMILAR PROJECTS WITH WHICH HE IS FAMILIAR. THE VETERINARY CURRICULUM SHOULD BE MODIFIED TO MAXIMIZE RELEVANCY. TEACHING TIME IN THE FOLLOWING SUBJECTS SHOULD BE INCREASED: ANIMAL HUSBANDRY, PREVENTIVE VETERINARY MEDICINE, EPIDEMIOLOGY, SOCIOLOGY, AGRICULTURAL ECONOMICS, STATISTICS, AND GRASSLAND FARMING. THERE IS A NEED FOR A CLOSER LIAISON BETWEEN THE VETERINARY ACADEMIC COMMUNITY AND OFF-CAMPUS ANIMAL AGRICULTURE PROFESSIONALS. THIS COULD BEST BE ACHIEVED BY SELECTING A VETERINARY FACULTY LIAISON OFFICER. THE DEVELOPMENT OF CLOSER ACADEMIC TIES WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERINARY SCIENCE AT THE UNIVERSITY OF IBADAN IS RECOMMENDED. SUCH THINGS AS STUDENT AND FACULTY EXCHANGE PROGRAMS, MEETINGS BETWEEN ADMINISTRATIVE STAFFS IN VETERINARY EDUCATION AND INTRAFACULTY SEMINARS ARE SUGGESTED. THE EVALUATOR SUPPORTS CONTINUATION OF THE PROJECT AND ADHERENCE TO THE PROGRAMMED PHASE III BUILDING PROJECT TO EXPAND VETERINARY PHYSICAL PLANT FACILITIES AND SUPPLY EQUIPMENT. THERE IS A NEED TO STRENGTHEN NATIONAL COORDIANTION OF ANIMAL PRODUCTION AND HEALTH ACTIVITIES. DUPLICATION AND REPETITION OF PRODUCTION RESEARCH IS EVIDENT IN SOME PROJECTS. EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION, RESEARCH PROTOCOL AND RESULTS BETWEEN SISTER PROJECTS AND DISSEMINATION OF RESEARCH RESULTS TO THE NATIONAL LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION SECTOR SHOULD BE IMPROVED.
Title: EVALUATION REPORT - PROJECT 817; VETERINARY EDUCATION; AHMADU BELLO UNIVERSITY, NIGERIA; KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY; USAID CONTRACT AID/AFR 707

ASSESSES IMPACT OF PROGRAM ON NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICES AND MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FUTURE NATIONAL HEALTH PROGRAMS.

Title: CONSULTANTS' REPORT - EVALUATION : SMALLPOX ERADICATION AND MEASLES CONTROL PROGRAM, CENTRAL AND WEST AFRICA (JANUARY-MARCH, 1971)

Abstract: THIS EVALUATION CONSISTED OF THREE PARTS: (1)INTERVIEWS; (2)A MAIL QUESTIONNAIRE; AND (3)VISITS TO SEVEN COUNTRIES. RESPONSES FROM THE MAIL SURVEY AND INTERVIEWS YIELD THE CONCLUSION THAT ATTITUDINAL AND COGNITIVE IMPACTS WERE ACHIEVED FOR APPROXIMATELY 75% OF THE PARTICIPANTS. MAIL RETURNS INDICATED THAT 67% OF THE PARTICIPANTS ACTED ON THE INFORMATION AND INSIGHTS THEY RECEIVED. WRITTEN AND INTERVIEW DATA SHOW THAT THE ACTIONS RANGED FROM SIMPLY ADVOCATING NUTRITION CONCEPTS AMONG COLLEAGUES THROUGH TEACHING COURSES AND CHANGING PERSONAL PRACTICES TO PREPARING NATIONAL PLANS AND NEW PROGRAMS. ALTHOUGH IT IS RARELY POSSIBLE TO ATTRIBUTE ORGANIZATIONAL AND NATIONAL IMPACT TO AN INDIVIDUAL OR TO A BRIEF FACET OF THEIR EXPERIENCE, IT WAS CLEAR THAT IN SOME CASES THE WORKSHOPS MADE A SUBSTANTIAL DIFFERENCE TO CRITICAL INDIVIDUALS AND IN OTHER CASES THEY REINFORCED OTHER EXPERIENCES AND PRESSURES TO WHICH PARTICIPANTS HAD BEEN EXPOSED. IN SPITE OF THE INDICATIONS OF IMPACT, MOST PARTICIPANTS FELT THAT EVEN MORE COULD HAVE BEEN GAINED. THEY FELT THAT THE HIGHLY STRUCTURED AND LARGELY THEORETICAL NATURE OF THE WORKSHOP SHOULD BE CHANGED AND THEY INDICATED THAT MORE BENEFIT WOULD HAVE BEEN DERIVED IF A VARIETY OF LEARNING TECHNIQUES HAD BEEN USED. IN SUMARRY, WHAT EMERGED FROM THE MAIL SURVEY AND COUNTRY VISITS IS A SENSE THAT THE TIME HAS COME FOR A COMPREHENSIVE, SYSTEMS-ORIENTED APPROACH TO THE PLANNING OF NUTRITION TRAINING. THE EVALUATORS MADE SEVEN RECOMMENDATIONS INCLUDING THAT THE WORKSHOPS BE MODIFIED AND CONTINUED.
Descriptors_Topical: Nutrition|Workshops|Nutrition education|Nutrition improvement|Health policy|Sector planning|Technical assistance
Title: FINAL REPORT : EVALUATION OF NUTRITION PLANNING WORKSHOPS

Abstract: Evaluates the Graduate Economics Training Program (PGTE) at the Federal University of Pernambuco as of 8/71.  PGTE was created to meet the demand for trained economists in northeast Brazil.  The study evaluates the present stage of PGTE's development based on a one-day visit to PGTE and discussions with Ford Foundation and USAID personnel. 24 students are presently enrolled in PGTE.  PGTE's master degree program began in l967. Only within FY 70, however, has the program developed to a level at which it can justifiably grant MA degrees to a regular graduation class (only one MA has been awarded to date).  PGTE is in a position today to issue a quality master degree primarily due to the efforts of Fuenzalida, the Vanderbilt professor financed by USAID. The rest of the faculty is capable and dedicated, but still young and inexperienced, both academically and administratively. The quality of the courses appears to be high and comparable to graduate courses in the US.  The curriculum could, however, be improved by adding at least one more required course in basic theory to the core curriculum, and by expanding the variety and number of optional courses. A strong curriculum in agricultural economics also needs to be developed. This can be accomplished through the proposed consortium with the Universidade Rural in Pernambuco, and with an additional visiting professor in agricultural economics. The most important barrier to continued improvement in PGTE is the absence of qualified leadership within the Brazilian faculty to replace Fuenzalida.  USAID should support Fuenzalida and 2 additional professors for another 2 years in hopes that, by that time, one of the Brazilians could take over. The PGTE faculty is now conducting contract research for such institutions as IPEA, CONDEPE, and SUDENE.  The quality of the research is good and additional contracts are contemplated.  PGTE is also interested in conducting research for USAID in the future in the the areas of income distribution and employment.  Overhead income for the research provides an important source of revenue for PGTE.
Title: EVALUATION OF THE GRADUATE ECONOMICS PROGRAM AT THE FEDERAL UNIVERSITY OF PERNAMBUCO (RECIFE)

Abstract: 11/23/71 LOAN COMPLETION REVIEW AND FINAL REPORT ON HIGHWAY CONSTRUCTION LOAN 512-L-015 FOR NINE SECTIONS OF STATE HIGHWAYS TOTALLING 489 KMS IN 6 NORTHEAST BRAZIL STATES. TWO OF NINE LOAN PROJECTS (BACABAL-LAGO DA PEDRA AND BARBALHA-MILAGRES SECTIONS) WERE CANCELLED WITH A COMMENSURATE REDUCTION IN FUNDING. WITH $18.4 MILLION AUTHORIZED AND $13.15 DISBURSED FOR THE COMPLETION OF THE SEVEN IMPLANTATION OR PAVING PROJ SEGMENTS, THE LOAN IS NOW CONSIDERED FULLY DISBURSED. THE LOAN GOALS HAVE BEEN ACHIEVED. THE BORROWER HAS MET ALL COVENANTS IN THE AGREEMENT AND HAS COMPLIED WITH ALL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. ALL AUDIT RECOMMENDATIONS HAVE BEEN SATISFACTORILY CLEARED AND MISSION MONITORING OF THE LOAN HAS BEEN COMPLETED.
Title: LOAN COMPLETION REVIEW AND FINAL REPORT

Abstract: EVALUATION REVIEWS 1966-1971 PERFORMANCE OF MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY'S LATIN AMERICAN MARKET PLANNING CENTER  (MSU/LAMP) UNDER CONTRACT AID/LA-364 & EVALUATES PROP FOR LAMP INVOLVEMENT IN PROPOSED FY71/FY74 AGRICULTURAL MARKETING SYSTEMS DVLP PROJECT. PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD PROVIDE LAMP/USDA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE DIRECTLY AND THROUGH THE CENTRO INTERAMERICANO DE COMERCIALIZACION  (CICOM) TO DEVELOP,IMPROVE THE INTERNAL MARKETING SYSTEMS OF LATIN AMERICAN NATIONS. EVALUATORS UNDERTOOK INTENSIVE EXAMINATION OF LAMP RESEARCH EFFORTS & INTERVIEWED AVAILABLE LAMP/USAID/LOCAL NATIONAL PROFESSIONALS IN PREVIOUS LAMP OPERATIONAL AREAS. LAMP COMPETENCE,RESEARCH SKILL AND LATIN AMERICAN EXPERIENCE ARE UNEQUIVOCALLY RECOGNIZED IN CONDUCTING SURVEY RESEARCH & DESIGNING APPLICABLE MODELS IN ITS RESEARCH OF LA PAZ/RECIFE/CALI AREA FOOD MARKETING SYSTEMS. EVALUATORS ACKNOWLEDGE APPARENT PLAUSIBILITY OF LAMP MODEL,BUT URGE DEVELOPMENT & CRITICAL REVIEW OF MORE RIGOROUS,PRECISE MODEL TO OFFER GUIDANCE IN SELECTION OF ALTERNATIVE REFORMS AND INVESTMENTS ON BASES OTHER THAN MARKET EFFICIENCY. WHILE RESEARCH EFFORTS WERE WELL-COORDINATED WITH LOCAL PROFESSIONALS,THEIR AD HOC NATURE AND LACK OF PLANNED INSTITUTIONALIZED FOLLOW-THROUGH HAMPERED IMPLEMENTATION OF VALUABLE RECOMMENDATIONS,ESPECIALLY IN BOLIVIA,BRAZIL WHERE 1 1/2 YEAR LAG IN LAMP REPORT SUBMISSION FURTHER LESSENED IMPLEMENTATION CHANCES. COLOMBIAN GOVT'S CREATION OF MARKETING AGENCY WITH CONTINUING LAMP ASSISTNCE DEMONSTRATES SUCCESSFUL FOLLOW-THROUGH. APPLYING LAMP EXPERIENCE TO PROPOSED PROP,EVALUATORS FIND CONCEPT SOUND, BUT URGE DEVELOPMENT OF CRITICALLY-TESTED CONCEPTUAL DEVELOPMENT MODEL. EXCLUSIVELY-MULTILATERAL FUNDING IS RECOMMENDED(USAID TO SUPPORT BILATERAL EFFORTS), WITH CICOM AS IMPLEMENTATION AGENCY CHARGED TO DIVERSIFY ITS RESEARCH PROGRAM TO MORE EFFECTIVELY STIMULATE DEVELOPMENT OF NATIONAL MARKETING INSTITUTIONS.
Descriptors_Topical: FOOD PRICES|Markets|Economic surveys|Food marketing|Information services|Institution building|Marketing research|FARM INCOME|Agricultural product marketing|Agricultural production|MARKETING|Limited data plus
Title: EVALUATION OF NATIONAL MARKET INTEGRATION PROJECT (598-15-260-440) : EVALUATION OF PROJECT PROP AND REVIEW OF PRIOR PERFORMANCE OF LATIN AMERICA MARKET PLANNING CENTER (LAMP)

Abstract: EVALUATES CENTRO COOPERATIVO TECHNICO INDUSTRIAL/CIVIC DEVELPROGRAM (CCTI/CD), CONSIDERING PROGRAM PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATN, IMPACT, ADMIN, OPERATION & TRNG FROM 1970 TO 1971. FIELD WORK & STUDY WAS SPREAD OVER 5 MNTHS DURING WHICH SOME ACTIVITIES DID NOT OCCUR SO THAT DIRECT OBSERVATN IS LIMITD. INFO ON THE FOUR PROMOTRS, PROGRAM DIRECTR &AID ADVISR WAS OBTAIND FROM CURRIC VITAE, OFFICE RECORDS & INTRVIEWS. AT FIELD LEVEL,CCTI/CD IS DESIGNED TO COMPLETE A SERIES OF 4 STAGES:EXPLORTN & MOTIVTN,SELECTN SEMINRS,BASIC COURSE & FOLLOW-UP. STAGE 1 ALLOWS PROMOTR TO MEET COMMNTY RESIDNTS TO ASSESS PROGRM RECEPTVTY & NEED. EXPLORTN IS FOLLOWD BY ANALYSIS OF COMMNTY DATA & PRESENTATN OF A MOTIVTN SEMINR TO ESTAB CONTACT WITH RECOGNIZED LOCAL LEADRS & TO PROMOTE COMMNTY RECEPTVTY BASIC 1-WK COURSE TEACHES CAMPESINOS SELECTD FROM MOTIVTN SEMINR. COURSES INCLUDE GOVT PROCESSES,HUMAN RELATNS,AGRARIAN REFORM LAW,HEALTH,EDUC,COOPS,CONSTITUTNL RIGHTS & DUTIES & PARLIAMNTRY PROCED. FOLLOW-UP VARIES WITH COMMNTIES BUT INCLUDES FARM-MARKT ROADS,WATER SYSTMS,PRIMRY & VOCATNL SCHOOLS,CLINICS,BRIDGES,LIBRARIES,COOPS,SMALL INDUS,LATRINE PROJCTS & LAND REFORM. AT FOLLOW-UP STAGE,PROMOTR PROVIDES INFO & SUPPORT TO COMMNTY ORGS,ARBITRATES BETWEEN COMMNTY FACTIONS,LINKS COMMUNTY TO GOVT & BUINESS & OBTAINS TECHNICNS TO ANSWERTECH QUESTIONS. EVAL FOUND TRENDS SUPPORTED BY FIELD SYUDY: MORE TIME SPENT IN STAGES 1 & 4RESULT IN GREATER NUMBR OF NEW ORGS; EMPHASIS ON STAGES 2 & 3 FILL INFO GAPS BUT DO NOT ASSURE COMMNTY ORGS; PROMOTR CONTACT BIAS LEADS TO LOWERD COMMNTY PARTIC. CAMPESINO REACTN TO PROGRM IS POSITIVE & REFLECTD IN: NUMBR OF NEW ORGS;FOLLOW-UP ACTVTIES;FEDERATN OF COMMUNTIES;2 INSTANCES OF LAND REFORMS;WILLINGNESS OF LEADRS & MEMBRS TO HOLD MEETINGS;ABILTY OF COMMNTIES TO DETRMNE A PROBM & ITS SOLUTN. IMPACT LEVEL IS CORRELATED TO PROMTR SKILL & AVAILBLTY & DEPENDNT ON LEADRS SELECTD FOR TRNG. THERE IS HIGH CORRLATN BETWEEN LEADRS TRND BY CCTI/CD & COMMNTY ORG LEADRS. INSTANCES OF RESISTNCE AMONG CAMPESINOS WERE RELATD TOSTRONG LOCAL CACIQUES OR ISOLATN/IGONORNCE FACTORS.
Descriptors_Topical: Rural development|Incentives|Community participation|Community self help|Community leadership|Community development|Education|Civic education
Title: EVALUATION OF THE CENTRO COOPERATIVO TECNICO INDUSTRIAL/CIVIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM - FINAL REPORT (DECEMBER 15, 1970 TO MAY 15, 1971)

Abstract: Evaluates usefulness of the Workshop on Agricultural College & Univ Development that was held from July 27 to Aug 8, 1969, based on a 13 question questionnaire that dealt with participants' impressions, workshop approach, presentatn of mtrls, usefulness to participants & suggestns for the future. Workshop gave good exposure to theoretical concepts & practical aspects of instit bldg.  Six approaches to presenting subject matter were used, of which presentatn of instit bldg models & concepts, case studies of instit bldg projects, and formal discussion of issues related to instit devel were most effective.  According to participants, the hyptothetical country problem, "Escondido," was useful, but case studies of actual countries would be more useful.  Teaching methods received varied responses.  Panel presentatn was judged the most effective. Foreign participants thought group discussns were more effective than did US participants. Knowledge gained was useful in participants' professionl work, especially for foreigners, because they could apply their knowledge to their own countries.  Participants identified ways in which rsrch coordination, linkages, leadership & internal structure concepts have been used in their work.  55% of the participants liked the "mix" of theoretical with applied subject matter.  Any future change should be in the direction of applied materials.  Adequate time to discuss the range of instit devel problems was provided.  A list of "areas believed inadequately approached" includes Sociological & Psychological aspects of modernization, Financing & efficient allocation of limited resources, continuity from one political generation to another, internal structure change in established institutions, and campus planning. Additional workshops recommended be held abroad as well as in US. University administrators from US and abroad, USAID officers and other technical assistance personnel, LDC government leaders, representatives from foundations, and bilateral and multilateral development assistance orgs would benefit from such a workshop. Appendices contain a sample questionnaire and selected answers.
Ancillary_Data: Workshop on Agricultural College and University Development (27|Jul-8 Aug 1969 : Lafayette, IN, US)|Evaluation period: 27 Jul 1969-8 Aug 1969

Title: Evaluation : workshop on agricultural college and university development

Abstract: EVALUATES USAID ASSISTANCE TO THE GOVT OF THE PHILIPPINES FROM FY62-FY68 TO UNDERTAKE SURVEYS AND STUDIES PREPARATORY TO THE FORMULATION OF COMPREHENSIVE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS FOR THE NATION'S SEVEN MAJOR RIVER BASINS. THE PROJECT BEGAN IN AUG, 1960 WHEN SERIOUS FLOOD LOSSES PROMPTED THE PRESIDENT OF THE PHILIPPINES TO REQUEST THE ASSISTANCE OF A US FLOOD CONTROL CONSULTANT. THE CONSULTANT'S WORK WAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE OTHER ASPECTS OF WATER UTILIZATION NOT ONLY IN CENTRAL LUZON BUT IN FIVE OTHER MAJOR RIVER BASINS. THE CONSULTANT RECOMMENDED A COMPREHENSIVE WATER RESOURCES SURVEY TO BE CONDUCTED BY A QUALIFIED TEAM OF EXPERTS. THE RECOMMENDATION WAS FAVORABLY ACCEPTED BY THE GOP & USAID ENTERED INTO A PASA WITH THE US BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (BUREC) FOR A WATER RESOURCES SURVEY TEAM. THE SEVEN MAJOR RIVER BASINS HAVE BEEN SURVEYED UNDER THIS PROJ. HOWEVER,INADEQUATE OR NOR-EXISTENT BASIC ENGINEERING,HYDROLOGIC,GEOLOGIC,SOILS & ECONOMIC DATA PREVENTED THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMPREHENSIVE PLANS FOR THE CAGAYAN,BICOL,COTABATO,AGUSAN & ILOG-HILABANGAN RIVER BASINS. THE REPORTS ON THESE FIVE BASINS WERE,THEREFORE,LIMITED TO BASIN INVENTORIES SPECIFYING POTENTIAL DAM & RESERVOIR SITES AND POTENTIAL AREAS FOR IRRIGATION,FISH CONSERVATION & WATER-BASED RECREATIONAL FACILITIES. THE REPORT ON THE CENTRAL LUZON BASIN PROPOSED 11 INTERRELATED BUT SEPARATE MULTI-PURPOSE WATER STORAGE AND REGULATION PROJS. THE UPPER PAMPANGA RIVER PROJ REPORT CONTAINED SUFFICIENTLY DETAILED TECHNICAL & ECONOMIC DATA TO ESTABLISH THE PROJECT'S FEASIBILITY. (THE WORKD BANK HAS COMMITTED A $34 MILLION LOAN FOR THE IRRIGATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT.) THE US BUREC TEAM ALSO PREPARED A MANUAL OF PRINCIPLES AND PROCEDURES TO GUIDE GOP AGENCIES IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF WATER RESOURCES. TECHNICIANS FROM THE BUREAU OF PUBLIC WORKS WERE GIVEN ON-JOB TRAINING AND 20 FILIPINO ENGINEERS AND GEOLOGISTS PARTICIPATED IN A US TRAINING PROGRAM.
Descriptors_Topical: Hydrological surveys|Water resources|Natural resource development|Limited data
Title: WATER RESOURCES SURVEY - PROJECT COMPLETION REPORT

Abstract: EVALUATES THE IMPACT (AS OF 5/15/71) OF A TRAINING PROGRAM AT LOYOLA UNIV'S INTER-AMERICAN CENTER (IAC) FOR HONDURANS IMMEDIATELY OR POTENTIALLY INFLUENTIAL IN NATL DEVEL. 161 HONDURANS HAD RECEIVED TRAINING AT TIME OF EVAL. ALTHOUGH MANY CAMPESINO LEADERS PARTICIPATED IN THE EARLIER YEARS OF THIS PROGRAM, SINCE 1969, THE PROGRAM HAS FOCUSED ON UPPER AND MIDDLE-LEVEL MGMT AND OPERATIONAL PERSONNEL. OBJECTIVES OF THIS RECENT IAC TRNG WERE TO HELP PARTICIPANTS PERCEIVE THE INDIVIDUAL'S OWN ROLE IN THE INSTITUTION, UNDERSTAND THE ROLE OF THE INSTIT, AND LEARN THE WAYS INDIVIDUALS CAN IMPROVE THEIR OWN PERFORMANCE WITHIN A SOCIAL-DEVELOPMENTAL CONTEXT. COURSES INCLUDED GROUP DYNAMICS SESSIONS, WRKSHPS IN BARRIERS TO CHANGE, CHARACTERISTICS AND METHODS OF CHANGE, AND THE DIMENSIONS AND IMPLICATIONS OF LEADERSHIP. THE CONTRACTOR FOR THIS EVAL DISTRIBUTED QUESTIONNAIRES TO AND CONDUCTED INTERVIEWS WITH RECENT TRNG GRADS TO DETERMINE PRESENT ACTIVITIES GRADS ARE ENGAGED IN, THEIR IMPACT ON SOCIETY, AND THEIR OPINIONS OF THE PROGRAM. THE FOLLOWING WAS DISCLOSED BY THIS EVAL: 1) THE TRNG CANDIDATE SELECTION PROCESS WAS INADEQUATE AND BIASED. MANY CANDIDATES SENT WOULD HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ON NATL DEVEL; MANY WERE DISINTERESTED IN THE TRNG OR ITS IMPLICATIONS AND PARTICIPATED SOLELY FOR PERSONAL FULFILLMENT OR JOB ADVANCEMENT; MANY WERE WEALTHY AND WERE GIVEN PREFERENTIAL TREATMENT IN THE SELCTN PROCESS; AND SEVERAL WERE POLITICAL "AGITATORS" WHO DIRECTLY OR UNINTENTIONALLY BROUGHT ABOUT DISCORD WITHIN THE TRNG GROUPS. 2) IAC COURSES WERE RATED GOOD TO EXCELLENT ALTHOUGH IT WAS FELT THAT A GREATER KNOWLEDGE OF LAT AMER CULTURAL VALUES AND THE LANGUAGE SHOULD BE ACQUIRED BY IAC STAFF. 3) ESTABLSHMNT OF IN-COUNTRY IAC-TYPE TRNG CNTRS WAS SUGGESTED -- SUCH INSTITUTIONS WOULD AT LEAST CREATE JOBS FOR HONDURAN IAC GRADS. 4) IAC GRADS BELIEVE THAT THE HONDURAN CULTURE IS BASED UPON FAMILY-KINSHIP RELATIONSHIPS AND NOT UPON RELATNSHPS WITH THE COMMUNITY OR OTHER INDIVIDUALS. 5) ONLY ABOUT 1/3 OF THE IAC GRADS ARE IN DECISION-MAKING OR AUTHORITARIAN POSITIONS. THUS, THE POSSIBLE IMPACT OF THE PROGRAM CANNOT REACH ITS ANTICIPATED LEVEL.
Descriptors_Topical: Mid level managers|Personnel development|Management training|Community participation|Community development|Beneficiary interviews
Title: EVALUATION OF THE IMPACT OF THE LOYOLA UNIVERSITY INTER-AMERICAN CENTER TRAINING PROGRAM ON GRADUATES IN HONDURAS

Abstract: EVALUATES SOUTHEAST ASIA DEVELOPMENT ADVISORY GROUP PERFORMANCE FROM 10/70-9/71. QUESTIONNAIRES WERE SENT TO ALL AID ACTION OFFICERS FOR SEADAG PANELS, THE PRINCIPAL PARTICIPANTS IN SEADAG SEMINARS FROM VARIOUS OFFICES IN THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE BUREAU, THE ASIAN COUNTRY DESK AND THE MISSIONS. REPLIES TO THE QUESTIONNAIRES INDICATE THAT SEADAG SHOULD BE CONTINUED FOR THE SECOND YEAR AND FUNDED AT A LEVEL COMMENSURATE WITH ITS IMPROVED PROGRAM FOCUS AND MANAGERIAL CAPABILITY.AID OFFICIALS NOW CONSIDER THE PLANNING FOR SEMINARS SATISFACTORY, THE NEW SEADAG SECRETARIAT COMPETENT TO EXECUTE ITS FUNCTIONS EFFECTIVELY, AND THE DIVISION OF RESEARCH FUNDS INTO SEPARATE SEADAG AND AID-CONTROLLED RESEARCH PROGRAMS SATISFACTORY. SOME PROBLEMS REMAIN, WITH THE MAJOR ONE BEING THE QUALITY OF AID PARTICIPATION IN SEADAG SEMINARS. WHILE THERE WAS SOME EXCELLENT AID PARTICIPATION IN ALL SEMINARS AND PLANNING SESSIONS HELD THIS PART YEAR, IT HAS NOT REACHED A SUFFICIENTLY HIGH LEVEL FOR ALL AID PARTICIPANTS. THE PRIMARY COMPLAINT VOICED BY BOTH AID ACTION OFFICERS AND ACADEMICS IS THAT AID STAFF TEND TO OBSERVE RATHER THAN PARTICIPATE AS ACTIVE CONTRIBUTORS IN THE SEMINAR. MAJOR CHANGES INCORPORATED INTO THE REVISED AGREEMENT, EFFECTIVE 10/1/70 INCLUDE: 1) GRANTING OF NEAR AUTONOMY TO SEADAG IN OPERATING ITS PROGRAMS; 2) DIVISION OF RESEARCH FUNDS INTO 2 PROGRAMS: ONE UNDER THE EXCLUSIVE CONTROL OF SEADAG -- EXCEPT FOR THE AMBASSADORIAL VETO, THE OTHER UNDER THE EXCLUSIVE CONTORL OF AID; 3) THAT THE DROPPING SEADAG MEMBERSHIP BE REPLACED BY PARTICIPATION BASED ON WILLINGNESS TO ASSUME AN ACTIVE AND CONTINUING PROFESSIONAL ROLE IN SEADAG PLUS POSSESSION OF SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE AND/OR COMPETENCE IN SOUTHEAST ASIA DEVELOPMENT; 4) AGREEMENT THAT AT LEAST ONE-THIRD OF THE SEMINARS WILL BE AID PROGRAM ORIENTED; 6) EMPHASIS ON CAREFUL PRE-SEMINAR PLANNING AND; 7) UPGRADING THE SECRETARIAT TO CARRY OUT THE PLANNING, ORGANIZATIONAL LEADERSHIP AND ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS NECESSARY FOR THE CONDUCT OF MEETINGS.
Descriptors_Topical: Development planning|National level|Regional development|Development organizations|Beneficiary interviews

Title: EVALUATION OF SEADAG, PHASE 1 : ADMINISTRATIVE REVIEW

Abstract: Evaluates project to improve industrial management and marketing practices in Uruguay.  No evaluation methodology is specified. Four subprojects involving the Faculty of Economics, the Interministerial Commission for Economic Development (CIDE), the Institute for the Development of Business Management (IDDE), and the Coordinating Commission for Economic Development (COMCORDE) were implemented under this project.  As part of the Faculty of Economics subproject, nine students were granted scholarships for academic degree training in public/business administration at the University of Chile. In addition, three professors from the University of Chile were recruited to conduct management courses at the Faculty of Economics. Also, grants were given to Uruguayan professors at the Faculty of Economics to attend a management development course in Pittsburgh and a management program in Lima.  CIDE personnel received grants to attend the International Marketing Institute and a course on management of industrial enterprises at Syracuse University.  USAID also financed a CIDE feasibility study concerning the establishment of a private development bank. The purpose of the IDDE subproject was to assist in developing modern administration and management techniques.  Numerous activities were carried out under this subproject. Examples include a two-day seminar on modern marketing principles and practices; courses on production planning and control, market research, and financial administration and analysis; and 700 hours of courses in management and administration by 60 experts from the Institute of Businesss Management of Argentina.  Under the COMCORDE subproject, a total of 15 studies were conducted on problems and special interests relating to the national economy.  USAID financial contribution to the overall project totalled $181,000.  All the planned projects have been completed, with the exception of some minor activities by COMCORDE.  Project has terminated.
Descriptors_Topical: Industrial development|Industrial economics|Administrative occupations|Management training|Economics education|Public administration|Business enterprises|Management|Institution building|Marketing research|Participants|Limited data

Title: INDUSTRIAL MANAGEMENT AND MARKETING PROJECT

Abstract: Evaluates project to upgrade the quality of agriculture and trade and industry vocational education in Thailand through an IBRD Loan for Improvement of Vocational Education (LIVE).  Evaluation, an incoming airgram dated 3/10/71, reports USOM/T's reply to a request by the Ministry of Education (MOE) to provide three consultants to evaluate LIVE's effectiveness and to design management data for forward planning. USOM felt that the study must be done by Thai's to be effective and agreed to provide one highly qualified consultant to work with a group of Thai specialists for up to 90 days.  The study will assess the relevance of existing LIVE objectives and goals, staff and participant selection, the adequacy of Royal Thai Government (RTG) financial support, school construction, equipment, record keeping and reporting procedures, adherence to IBRD administrative requirements, cost/benefit analysis, manpower demands, and the project plan. The study will be published as a report in both Thai and English.  An evaluation system will also be designed whereby the MOE can continually monitor the program's effectiveness. The U.S. consultant must be a person of maturity and status, with a strong background in vocational education and survey-research system design.  MOE educators should have expertise in educational planning, educational finance, vocational education curriculum development, economics of education, vocational education and administration, school architecture and construction, and manpower planning data analysis. Adequate secretarial/clerical help and a full-time Thai coordinator should be available to work with the U.S. consultant.  The RTG will provide office space, equipment, and supplies, while the Trust Fund account will pay for local transportation and per diem for the U.S. consultant.  Funds will be made available for printing and distributing the final report. USOM/T recommends that AID/W begin recruiting consultants, for either a personal services contract or on a short-term direct hire consultant basis, as soon as possible.
Descriptors_Topical: Curriculum design|Vocational training|Evaluation|Educational delivery|Institution building|Agricultural education|Indigenous education|Educational planning|Educational policy|National level|Limited data

Abstract: This report evaluates the training programs for Indian extension workers at the University of Missouri.  Seventy-three mail questionnaires were sent to selected institutions, and 54 of the 87 Indian extension workers were interviewed.  The report contains a thorough description of the status of returnees in this field and their views about their training experiences. Suggestions are made for making future programs more effective. (Participant training abstract)
